item.title: WooDoo African Blackwood Earrings W11
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
These wonderful earrings were recreated by WooDoo on our special request in extremely rare and valuable African Blackwood. This request was made specifically to complement WooDoo's magnificent African Blackwood W07 and W08 rings. The earrings are complete with delicate and graceful silver pins. Fluent, unique and minimalist, these earrings have a sense of presence and style that is easily recognizable and truly memorable.

The post WooDoo African Blackwood Earrings W11 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.
item.content:encoded:
These wonderful earrings were recreated by WooDoo on our special request in extremely rare and valuable African Blackwood. This request was made specifically to complement WooDoo’s magnificent African Blackwood W07 and W08 rings. The earrings are complete with delicate and graceful silver pins. Fluent, unique and minimalist, these earrings have a sense of presence and style that is easily recognizable and truly memorable.

Materials

African Blackwood is a very rare and expensive wood, exhibiting moisture repellent qualities, as well as incredible dimensional stability. This precious wood is highly valued since the ancient times, when its primary usage purposes included furniture and musical instruments. Considered the original ebony thousand of years ago, this wood was imported to and processed in Ancient Egypt. The name “ebony’ is actually derived from Egyptian “hbny”, while other names for this wood include babanus, grenadilla and mpingo. The African Blackwood tree itself takes about 60 years to mature and originates from seasonally dry regions of Senegal, as well as similar regions east to Eritrea and south to Transvaal.

African Blackwood is a lustrous wood that is one of the hardest and densest in the world.  The color hue of African Blackwood ranges from reddish dark brown and purple to pure black. This timber exhibits little or no straight grain and has an even texture. Extremely durable in terms of resistance to decay, African Blackwood is also moderately resistant to insect attacks. While beautiful and durable, this precious wood is notorious for its blunting effect on wood cutters, making it very difficult to work with either by hand or with machine tools. Although pretty much indiscernible upon completion, African Blackwood has a mild distinctive scent that it emits while being processed. Among many precious woods, African Blackwood is considered one of the very finest timbers to be used in producing turned wood objects.

About WooDoo

WooDoo is an incredibly magentic contemporary jewelry brand unlike any other. WooDoo is concerned with creative exploration of space, its geometric properties, as well as the possibilities of their tangible expression. All of this combines into a very original and unique aesthetic. WooDoo’s works are true artistic explorations of the properties of space. These explorations stem from visions of space that get translated into the physical world by means of minimalist tangible objects. But even after receiving physical form, WooDoo’s jewelry pieces feel deeply rooted in the realm of creative and visionary.

WooDoo’s accessories are truly memorable, commanding attention and recognition and are handcrafted from a number of select tactile precious woods, like African Blackwood or Purpleheart Wood. Each of WooDoo’s jewelry pieces carries an unmistakably modern, contemporary jewelry aesthetic. It is this aesthetic, along with skillful execution that WooDoo’s accessories owe to the duo of creative designers, standing behind this unique and visionary brand.

The post WooDoo African Blackwood Earrings W11 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.

About WooDoo

WooDoo is an extraordinary, magnetic, and minimalist jewelry brand. WooDoo is about creative exploration of space and its geometric properties. WooDoo’s quest is an inquiry into the possibilities of tangible expression of this visionary aesthetic. This brand’s jewelry transcends the realm of physical, bridging the tangible and the creative.

WooDoo pieces are majestic and truly memorable, while being handcrafted from a number of select precious woods, including African Blackwood, Bog Oak or Purpleheart Wood. Each of the brand’s pieces is an original and unique experience of jewelry aesthetic. It is this aesthetic, along with skillful execution that WooDoo’s accessories owe to the duo of creative designers standing behind this visionary brand.

The post WooDoo African Blackwood Earrings W14 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.

item.title: WooDoo African Blackwood Ring W07
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
This ring by WooDoo is an incredible piece of contemporary jewelry crafted from extremely rare, and valuable wood. It is an artistic exploration of space that is a creative inquiry into the elegance of spatial geometry. This metaphysical inquiry is skilfully embodied in tactile and precious African Blackwood. As such, it manifests a fluent connection between the worlds of physical-tangible and ethereal-creative. This unique ring has a sense of presence and style that is easily recognizable and truly memorable.

Ring sizes specified in the table below are available in stock and are ready to ship immediately. You can specify your size in the Order Notes field on the Checkout page or we shall contact you for details. Otherwise, please allow up to 5 business days for the creation of your custom ring. We also highly recommend you to consider the factors outlined here when determining your ring size, as well as consulting this excellent ring size conversion chart. If you need help determining your ring size, contact us through the chat app on this site.

[table id=1 /]

The post WooDoo African Blackwood Ring W07 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.

item.title: WooDoo Bog Oak Bracelet with a Hidden Print W04
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
A conceptual piece, this bracelet is made with extremely rare and valuable bog oak. The look of the centerpiece on a minimalist leather strap mimics that of a watch, except the watch-face is replaced with a print. The monochromatic print is only visible from an angle, giving this bracelet a look that is literally timeless, mysterious and elegant. The aesthetics of bog oak, which takes thousands of years to mature, hint at the endurance, change and immensity of passing time. This beautiful and monumental concept is complemented with a print reminiscent of a crystalline structure. Looking at this watch-inspired bracelet is a bit like staring into infinite and eternal space, making the question of 'what time is it?' a bit redundant. Skillfully crafted, this bracelet is a stunning contemporary piece that is minimalist, creative and unique.

Bog Oak is an exceptionally rare form of timber that is comparable to some of the most expensive tropical hardwoods. It is notable for high strength and magnificent beauty. Other common names of bog-wood include abanos and morta. Essentially, bog oak is oak wood in the early stages of fossilization. This type of wood cannot be produced artificially, so it can only be obtained from natural sources like peat bogs and river beds. Having been submerged in acidic, oxygen-free conditions, this type of wood takes literally hundreds, but more often thousands of years to "mature". During this time iron and minerals from the water bind with tannin in the wood, resulting in a considerably darker, golden-brown to pure black color, as well as a significantly increased hardness and density. Due to this density, bog oak can only be carved with exceptionally firm tools.

The post WooDoo Bog Oak Bracelet with a Hidden Print W04 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.
item.content:encoded:
A conceptual piece, this bracelet is made with extremely rare and valuable bog oak. The look of the centerpiece on a minimalist leather strap mimics that of a watch, except the watch-face is replaced with a print. The monochromatic print is only visible from an angle, giving this bracelet a look that is literally timeless, mysterious and elegant. The aesthetics of bog oak, which takes thousands of years to mature, hint at the endurance, change and immensity of passing time. This beautiful and monumental concept is complemented with a print reminiscent of a crystalline structure. Looking at this watch-inspired bracelet is a bit like staring into infinite and eternal space, making the question of ‘What time is it?’ a bit redundant. Skillfully crafted, this bracelet is a stunning contemporary piece that is minimalist, creative and unique.

Materials

Bog Oak is an exceptionally rare form of timber that is comparable to some of the most expensive tropical hardwoods. It is notable for high strength and magnificent beauty. Other common names of bog-wood include abanos and morta. Essentially, bog oak is oak wood in the early stages of fossilization. This type of wood cannot be produced artificially, so it can only be obtained from natural sources like peat bogs and river beds. Having been submerged in acidic, oxygen-free conditions, this type of wood takes literally hundreds, but more often thousands of years to “mature”. During this time iron and minerals from the water bind with tannin in the wood, resulting in a considerably darker, golden-brown to pure black color, as well as a significantly increased hardness and density. Due to this density, bog oak can only be carved with exceptionally firm tools.

Since supply of bog oak is so limited, prices for this type of wood are quite high. This is attributable to the fact that sites of bog oak are extremely rare and hard to access. The recovery of bog-wood trunks is often a difficult and engaging process, requiring meticulous preparation. At the same time, the much anticipated moment of extraction is the wood’s first exposure to light in hundreds and thousands of years. Extracted bog-wood is very delicate and requires complex desiccation. Nevertheless, despite great care most of the raw wood is not suitable for processing. Processing itself is notoriously unpredictable as some parts may be supple, while others very hard. All of this implies high value of raw and processed bog-oak wood.

From the viewpoint of aesthetics, bog-oak is a genuine experience of naturally formed color. This is particularly appealing to material connoisseurs who point to exquisite permeation of wood structure by the dark and noble color. The authenticity of this wood is complemented by its texture and grain. Parts of the wood may become combined, creating variations in color, as well as direction of growth rings. This imperfect appearance often adds to the aesthetic of bog-wood, conveying a powerful message of intensity of the past times, as well as longevity of the wood and the fact of its remaining intact. It may very well be the reason why in the nineteenth century bog oak was used to make exceptionally beautiful carved decorative jewelry.

As to the symbolism and metaphysical properties associated with the materials used in this bracelet, oak is one of the most sacred trees that stands for the invocation of wisdom, authority, endurance, strength and protection. Oak is also believed to bring vitality and long life and is considered among the most powerful and sacred Druid woods. In Ancient Celtic culture oak was considered to be the protector. Oak wood is also used as healing wood and is believed to aid in focusing the mind on the task at hand. Oak is said to inspire bravery, presence, leadership and enduring strength.

About WooDoo

WooDoo is an incredibly magnetic contemporary jewelry brand unlike any other. WooDoo is concerned with creative exploration of space, its geometric properties, as well as the possibilities of their tangible expression. All of this combines into a very original and unique aesthetic. WooDoo’s works are true artistic explorations of the properties of space. These explorations stem from visions of space that get translated into the physical world by means of minimalist tangible objects. But even after receiving physical form, WooDoo’s jewelry pieces feel deeply rooted in the realm of creative and visionary.

WooDoo’s accessories are truly memorable, commanding attention and recognition and are handcrafted from a number of select tactile precious woods, like African Blackwood or Purpleheart Wood. Each of WooDoo’s jewelry pieces carries an unmistakably modern, contemporary jewelry aesthetic. It is this aesthetic, along with skillful execution that WooDoo’s accessories owe to the duo of creative designers, standing behind this unique and visionary brand.

The post WooDoo Bog Oak Bracelet with a Hidden Print W04 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.

item.title: WooDoo Bog Oak Bracelet with Floral Print W05
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
A conceptual piece this bracelet is made with extremely rare and valuable bog oak. The look of the centerpiece on a minimalist leather strap mimics that of a watch, except the watch-face is replaced with a print. This golden floral print stands out elegantly, adding some welcome warmth to the all black color scheme. The aesthetics of bog oak, which takes thousands of years to mature, hint at the balance of endurance and change in the face of passing time. This concept is contrasted with a warm and inviting golden floral print that can be seen to symbolize nature. Skillfully crafted, this bracelet is a stunning contemporary piece that is minimalist, creative and unique.

Bog Oak is an exceptionally rare form of timber that is comparable to some of the most expensive tropical hardwoods. It is notable for high strength and magnificent beauty. Other common names of bog-wood include abanos and morta. Essentially, bog oak is oak wood in the early stages of fossilization. This type of wood cannot be produced artificially, so it can only be obtained from natural sources like peat bogs and river beds. Having been submerged in acidic, oxygen-free conditions, this type of wood takes literally hundreds, but more often thousands of years to "mature". During this time iron and minerals from the water bind with tannin in the wood, resulting in a considerably darker, golden-brown to pure black color, as well as a significantly increased hardness and density. Due to this density, bog oak can only be carved with exceptionally firm tools.

The post WooDoo Bog Oak Bracelet with Floral Print W05 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.

These explorations stem from visions of space that get translated into the physical world by means of minimalist tangible objects. But even after receiving physical form, WooDoo’s jewelry pieces feel deeply rooted in the realm of creative and visionary.

WooDoo’s accessories are truly memorable, commanding attention and recognition and are handcrafted from a number of select tactile precious woods, like African Blackwood or Purpleheart Wood. Each of WooDoo’s jewelry pieces carries an unmistakably modern, contemporary jewelry aesthetic. It is this aesthetic, along with skillful execution that WooDoo’s accessories owe to the duo of creative designers, standing behind this unique and visionary brand.

item.title: WooDoo Deer Antler Ring W09
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
This deer antler ring is created to showcase the beauty and finesse of a natural material historically used in jewelry-making for tens of thousands of years. Polished deer antlers boast a great palette of original color shades, complemented by an authentic texture and a unique tactile feel that seems different, but somehow familiar at the same time. An original idea for a rustic designer ring, this accessory may  be considered a tribute to some of the earliest man-made jewelry, as well as poetic, yet raw beauty of nature. Being larger in size, the ring stands out with a flare of natural colors and unique tactile feel, as well as a unique patch of unpolished antler texture on the upper of the ring.

Ring sizes specified in the table below are available in stock and are ready to ship immediately. You can specify your size in the Order Notes field on the Checkout page or we shall contact you for details. Otherwise, please allow up to 5 business days for the creation of your custom ring. We also highly recommend you to consider the factors outlined here when determining your ring size, as well as consulting this excellent ring size conversion chart. If you need help determining your ring size, contact us through the chat app on this site.

The post WooDoo Deer Antler Ring W09 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.
item.content:encoded:
This deer antler ring is created to showcase the beauty and finesse of a natural material historically used in jewelry-making for tens of thousands of years. Deer antlers boast a great palette of original color shades, complemented by an authentic texture and a unique tactile feel that seems different, but somehow familiar at the same time. An original idea for a rustic designer ring, this accessory may  be considered a tribute to some of the earliest man-made jewelry, as well as poetic, yet raw beauty of nature. Being larger in size, the ring stands out with a flare of natural colors and unique tactile feel, as well as a unique patch of unpolished antler texture on the upper of the ring.

Materials

Antlers are extensions of the skull, seasonally grown and shed by members of the deer family. Antlers are true bone that grows symmetrically in pairs and are mostly attributable to males. The growth of these unique structures places a considerable nutritional strain on the body of a deer. The size of antlers speaks of a deer’s ability to navigate and find enough food in its environment. Since the prehistoric times antlers were used to make tools, weapons and jewelry. Some antlers have unique properties, as is the case with moose antlers that greatly aid a moose’s hearing. Antlers are well known for their use by Magdalenian culture in European Late Paleolithic. From this culture, modern museums inherited a number of beautifully carved and engraved pieces of prehistoric art, including this ‘Bison Licking Insect Bite‘ spear-thrower fragment created sometime between 10,000 – 18,000 BC.

About WooDoo

WooDoo is an extraordinary, magnetic, and minimalist jewelry brand. WooDoo is about creative exploration of space and its geometric properties. WooDoo’s quest is an inquiry into the possibilities of tangible expression of this visionary aesthetic. This brand’s jewelry transcends the realm of physical, bridging the tangible and the creative.

WooDoo pieces are majestic and truly memorable, while being handcrafted from a number of select precious woods, including African Blackwood, Bog Oak or Purpleheart Wood. Each of the brand’s pieces is an original and unique experience of jewelry aesthetic. It is this aesthetic, along with skillful execution that WooDoo’s accessories owe to the duo of creative designers standing behind this visionary brand.

The post WooDoo Deer Antler Ring W09 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.

item.title: WooDoo Deer Antler Ring W10
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
This deer antler ring is created to showcase the beauty and finesse of a natural material historically used in jewelry-making for tens of thousands of years. Polished deer antlers boast a great palette of original color shades, complemented by an authentic texture and a unique tactile feel that seems different, but somehow familiar at the same time. The resulting polished deer antler ring in this case is understated and casual. Its tactile feel is pleasant and has an unexpected warmth to it. The texture surface is mostly smooth, while interesting small variations in pattern and color can be discovered upon a more careful examination. This original ring has prominent casual appeal, feeling so comfortable you might want to wear it every day.

If you need help determining your ring size, contact us through the chat app on this site.

Its tactile feel is pleasant and has an unexpected warmth to it. The texture surface is mostly smooth, while interesting small variations in pattern and color can be discovered upon a more careful examination. This original ring has prominent casual appeal, feeling so comfortable you might want to wear it every day.

Materials

Antlers are extensions of the skull, seasonally grown and shed by members of the deer family. Antlers are true bone that grows symmetrically in pairs and are mostly attributable to males. The growth of these unique structures places a considerable nutritional strain on the body of a deer. The size of antlers speaks of a deer’s ability to navigate and find enough food in its environment. Since the prehistoric times antlers were used to make tools, weapons and jewelry. Some antlers have unique properties, as is the case with moose antlers that greatly aid a moose’s hearing. Antlers are well known for their use by Magdalenian culture in European Late Paleolithic. From this culture, modern museums inherited a number of beautifully carved and engraved pieces of prehistoric art, including this ‘Bison Licking Insect Bite‘ spear-thrower fragment created sometime between 10,000 – 18,000 BC.

WooDoo is an extraordinary, magnetic, and minimalist jewelry brand. WooDoo is about creative exploration of space and its geometric properties. item.title: WooDoo Engineered Stone Earrings W17
item.dc:creator: onewithclouds
item.description:
These wonderful earrings were recreated by WooDoo on our special request in extremely rare and valuable African Blackwood. This request was made specifically to complement WooDoo's casual Deer Antler W10 ring. The earrings are complete with delicate and graceful silver pins. Fluent, unique and minimalist, these earrings have a sense of presence and style that is easily recognizable and truly memorable.

Engineered Stone is a material that considerably improves upon the properties of natural stone. Engineered stone was invented in Italy in early 1980s by Marcello Toncelli, founder of world-renowned Breton S.P.A. This type of stone is tailor-made with a mix of stone/marble powder, low-viscosity/high-strength epoxy or resin, a supplement of coloring, stabilizers and UV absorbing additives. To complement stone/marble powder aggregates, materials like colored glass or metal flakes can be added. Depending on the composition of stone powders and their intended application, there exist two major types of engineered stone - marble and quartz.

The post WooDoo Engineered Stone Earrings W17 appeared first on Nuage Showroom.
item.content:encoded:
These wonderful earrings were created by WooDoo to complement the casual Deer Antler W10 ring. The earrings are complete with delicate and graceful silver pins. Fluent, unique and minimalist, these earrings have a sense of presence and style that is easily recognizable and truly memorable.

Materials

Engineered Stone is a material that considerably improves upon the properties of natural stone. Engineered stone was invented in Italy in early 1980s by Marcello Toncelli, founder of world-renowned Breton S.P.A. This type of stone is tailor-made with a mix of stone/marble powder, low-viscosity/high-strength epoxy or resin, a supplement of coloring, stabilizers and UV absorbing additives. To complement stone/marble powder aggregates, materials like colored glass or metal flakes can be added. Depending on the composition of stone powders and their intended application, there exist two major types of engineered stone – marble and quartz.

Engineered stone is mainly worked with a water jet cutter or a diamond blade. It is less porous, exhibiting a uniform structure without any hidden internal cracks or flaws. The binding resin allows for some flexibility, preventing engineered stone from cracking. This property decreases over time, as resins continue to harden during a product’s lifetime. It is worth noting that engineered stone is not completely UV stable, so a very long exposure to UV light might result in color changes and breakdown of the epoxy or resin binding agents.

About WooDoo

WooDoo is an extraordinary, magnetic, and minimalist jewelry brand. WooDoo is about creative exploration of space and its geometric properties. WooDoo’s quest is an inquiry into the possibilities of tangible expression of this visionary aesthetic. This brand’s jewelry transcends the realm of physical, bridging the tangible and the creative.

WooDoo pieces are majestic and truly memorable, while being handcrafted from a number of select precious woods, including African Blackwood, Bog Oak or Purpleheart Wood. Each of the brand’s pieces is an original and unique experience of jewelry aesthetic. It is this aesthetic, along with skillful execution that WooDoo’s accessories owe to the duo of creative designers standing behind this visionary brand.
